00057 
00058         /*
00059          * epi_egent: representation of a person in the model
00060          *
00061          * next         -- pointer used by LPs to build priority queue container of agents
00062          * prev         -- pointer used by LPs to build priority queue container of agents
00063          * up           -- pointer used by LPs to build priority queue container of agents
00064          * ts_remove    -- time the agent will remove itself from location LP
00065          * ts_next      -- minimum of ts_remove and ts_stage_tran, used for queuing
00066          * type         -- the type of person represented
00067          * stage        -- disease stage
00068          * ts_stage_tran - transition time to next stage 
00069          * ts_last_tran -- time of last transition (i.e. to current stage)
00070          * ts_infected  -- time agent caught disease (became infected)
00071          * n_infected   -- number of other agents infected by this agent
00072          * curr         -- the current position in the location vector
00073          * nloc         -- the size of the location vector
00074          * loc          -- the location vector
00075          */
00076 DEF(struct, epi_agent)
00077 {
00078         /* these 4 vars are need for PQ */
00079         epi_agent       *volatile next;
00080         epi_agent       *volatile prev;
00081         epi_agent       *volatile up;
00082         int              heap_index;
00083 
00084         tw_stime         ts_remove;
00085         tw_stime         ts_next;
00086 
00087         epi_agent_t      a_type;
00088         epi_stage_t      stage;
00089 
00090         tw_stime         ts_stage_tran;
00091         tw_stime         ts_last_tran;
00092 
00093         tw_stime         ts_infected;
00094         unsigned int     n_infected;
00095 
00096         unsigned int     id;
00097         int              curr;
00098         signed int       dir;
00099 
00100         unsigned int     nloc;
00101         int             *loc;
00102         tw_stime        *dur;
00103 
00104         // Network User Model Add-Ons
00105         num_state       *num;
00106         num_agent_t      n_type;
00107 
00108         // This is the type for this event
00109         int              e_type;
00110 };
